## Action Performed:
Break down in numbered steps

1. Open the chat switcher
2. type a name of someone you know and have a chat with

## Expected Result:
Describe what you think should've happened

The focus should autofocus on the first result so that you dont need to click arrow down and you need to enter

## Actual Result:
Describe what actually happened

This is flaky, it seems to focus on the first result sometimes but not always - probably some race condition

## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

title: [$250] Add guard in OnyxUtils to skip subscriptions for invalid keys

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Background Some code paths attempt to subscribe to collection members whose IDs are invalid (e.g., report_undefined, ..._null, ..._NaN). Even with skippableCollectionMemberIDs configured, these invalid keys still create a subscription and emit an initial callback, adding overhead and noise. ### Problem Subscriptions are created for invalid keys like report_undefined, which still emit an initial callback and add overhead. ### Solution Add a guard in OnyxUtils.subscribeToKey that checks skippableCollectionMemberIDs and, if the collection member ID is skippable (e.g., 'undefined', 'null', 'NaN'), do not connect the subscription or emit the initial value, but return a subscriptionID so disconnect() is safe. #### Results Reduces fireCallbacks invocations by ~12% skipping all the invalid collection IDs ### Next steps Do testing and comparison of the effect of this change in real account
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit

  • Upwork Job ID: 1986409233270874405
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-11-06

Open the Workspace List page 2. Turn off the internet 3. Duplicate a workspace (without enabling Distance Rate) 4. Confirm the duplication 5. Open the duplicated workspace 6. Turn the internet connection back on ## Expected Result: Possibly the Distance Rate section should not be displayed in select features to copy ## Actual Result: Distance rate section checked and displayed in select features to copy, the Distance Rate section is displayed in workspace and, after turning the internet back on, the Distance Rate section becomes hidden. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.45-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71330 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** any new gmail account **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac / Safari **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. Log in with a new account. 2. Go offline. 3. Start a chat with any other account. 4. Click + → Pay. 5. Enter an amount and click Continue. 6. Click Pay, then choose Mark as Paid or Personal Bank Account. 7. Validate that the selected account is displayed. 8. Go online. 9. Input the correct magic code. ## Expected Result: The account validation modal should close, the confirmation page should display, and the email of the account to which the payment is intended should be shown. ## Actual Result: The confirmation page displays “Hidden” instead of the account email. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5ad28844-ad9b-49ad-a1bc-f2e3d8319dbe [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.45-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1832/folder/13176922/51874675/996804554 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Win 11/Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Login with new account - Create a workspace - Go to workspace chat create 2 reports - Create 2 manual expense for each report 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Click on Reports tab 3. Click on "X" button for closing filter "type:expense action:submit from:me" 4. Click on View of the first expense 5. Click on expense report name on the header 6. Observe the number next arrow button 7. Click on Next button and observe the number next arrow 8. Click on Next button ## Expected Result: - The pagination at arrow should display count of report/Total report. As this case, at step 5 should display "1 of 2" and step 6 should display "2 of 2" - At step 7, arrow button should blur when there no next report ## Actual Result: - The pagination at arrow is displayed count of report/Total expense. At step 5 there's displayed "1 of 4", at step 6 there's displayed "2 of 4". - At step 7, arrow button is clickable but not respond when click on it ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/489f99a2-cb08-48f7-9a20-151716350729 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
